article.title: Differentially Private Query Learning: from Data Publishing to Model Publishing

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the symbol "SFy" represent in the Laplace Method flow?
choices: The predicted answers for queries Fy.
The sensitivity of the query set Fy.
The noise added to the query answers.
The training set for the Laplace Method.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key difference between the output of the Laplace Method and the MLDP method?
choices: Laplace Method outputs noisy answers directly, while MLDP outputs a prediction model.
Laplace Method uses a training set, while MLDP uses the entire dataset.
Laplace Method handles fresh queries, while MLDP cannot.
Laplace Method has lower sensitivity than MLDP.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why is the noise added to the training set in the MLDP method potentially smaller than the noise added to the query set in the Laplace method?
choices: MLDP uses a smaller privacy budget.
MLDP's training set Fx is carefully selected to have lower correlation, resulting in lower sensitivity.
MLDP only adds noise to a subset of the queries.
MLDP doesn't add noise to the training set.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary goal of MLDP?
choices: To protect the privacy of individual records in the dataset.
To enable traditional machine learning tasks on private data.
To publish a model that can predict answers to fresh queries while preserving privacy.
To classify data samples with high accuracy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does a lower MAE value indicate in the context of the MLDP method?
choices: Higher sensitivity of the queries.
Stronger privacy guarantee.
Larger size of the training set.
Better utility of the published model.
